intro: Pentacalia freemanii, commonly known as the Freeman's pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and thrives in partial to full sun. It is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks, where it contributes to the local biodiversity. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
